r.s: Event-driven asynchronous and concurrent networking engine with high performance for PHP.
r.d: Event-driven asynchronous and concurrent networking engine with high performance for PHP. - event-driven - coroutine - asynchronous non-blocking - multi-thread reactor - multi-process worker - multi-protocol - millisecond timer - built-in tcp/http/websocket/http2 server - coroutine tcp/http/websocket client - coroutine mysql client - coroutine redis client - coroutine read/write file system - coroutine dns lookup - support IPv4/IPv6/UnixSocket/TCP/UDP - support SSL/TLS encrypted transmission
r.n: - Fix the need to use `zend_ini_parse_quantity` to parse string numbers for PHP versions greater than 8.2. @matyhtf - Fix an occasional resource unavailability issue when coroutineizing `pdo_pgsql`. @NathanFreeman - Fix header file reference issues when coroutineizing `pdo_pgsql`. @NathanFreeman - Fix incorrect relative path checks to avoid bypassing path validation. @matyhtf - Fix incorrect concurrency count caused by process restarts in high-concurrency environments. @matyhtf - Sync some related code for `php8.3 curl`. @NathanFreeman - Fix core test errors in the `process` module. @NathanFreeman - In `SWOOLE_BASE` mode, all connections should be closed during the `PHP RSHUTDOWN` phase. @matyhtf - Optimize kernel code. @matyhtf
